intro: Byttneria celtoides, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pink or white flowers. The plant produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and riverine habitats. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
